greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of Product_{j>=1} 1/(1 - j^k*x^j).
formula: A(0,k) = 1 and A(n,k) = (1/n) * Sum_{j=1..n} (Sum_{d|j} d^(1+k*j/d)) * A(n-j,k) for n > 0. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 02 2017
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0 or i=1, 1,
seq(seq(A(n, d-n), n=0..d), d=0..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 11 2017
mathematica: col[k_] := col[k] = Product[1/(1 - j^k*x^j), {j, 1, m}] + O[x]^(m+1) // CoefficientList[#, x]&;
Table[A[n, d-n], {d, 0, m}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 11 2021 *)
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Sep 11 2017
